text:
You can only add contact list membership and contact lifecycle stage as smart rules for emails. Although we can use the same recipient lists to split these out with smart rules :+1:

So once I've separated out the hubl/tokens (either by separate emails or smart rules), how would I go about changing the format of each? I can't seem to find a way to differ from the default setup in HubSpot's main settings. :thinking_face:
Can we have an external website not with HubSpot on <http://www.mydomain.com|www.mydomain.com> et landing pages with HubSpot on <http://xxx.mydomain.com|xxx.mydomain.com>?
Yes, you set up the subdomain for the landing page content type in HubSpot, and simply update your DNS with the given records.
Hey folks! Is content published in staging, or URLs containing the “<http://hs-sites.com|hs-sites.com>” in the domain, automatically have a noindex? <@U22PKFRU5>
Hey Brendan, that is correct, anything hosted on an `<http://hs-sites.com|hs-sites.com>` domain is automatically set to noindex
Yeah, having critical css inlined in the head and the rest deferred can be more performant
Is performant recognized as a real word yet? I feel like in development world I can say it, but outside of that people give me the stank eye
i would say that if the css is ginormus that this would be noticable performance increase. BUT in most of the sites i create it is not really noticable.
Yes Google would love it, but that doenst mean it actually looks faster
